SEARCH
Package Engine

Class TaskScheduler

java.lang.Object
Engine.TaskScheduler
public class TaskScheduler extends Object
The TaskScheduler class provides a way to schedule and execute tasks at specific intervals. It uses a priority queue to manage the tasks based on their delay time.
Author:
haotian

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    TaskScheduler.ForEachTask<T>
    Represents a SchedulerTask for iterating over an array of data elements.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.ForTask
    Represents a SchedulerTask for iterating a specific number of times.
    static interface 
    TaskScheduler.lambda
    Functional interface for lambda expressions used in tasks.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.SchedulerTask
    Represents a task that can be scheduled and executed by the TaskScheduler.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.SchedulerTaskParam<T>
    Represents a SchedulerTask with a parameter.

    • scheduleTask

      public TaskScheduler.SchedulerTask scheduleTask(double seconds, TaskScheduler.lambda x)
      Schedules a task with the specified delay and lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The delay in seconds before executing the task.
      x - The lambda expression to execute.
      Returns:
      The scheduled SchedulerTask instance.

    • scheduleTask

      public <T> TaskScheduler.SchedulerTaskParam<T> scheduleTask(double seconds, Consumer<T> x, T data)
      Schedules a task with the specified delay, consumer function, and data.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the data.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The delay in seconds before executing the task.
      x - The consumer function to execute.
      data - The data to pass to the consumer function.
      Returns:
      The scheduled SchedulerTaskParam instance.

    • scheduleForEachTask

      public <T> TaskScheduler.ForEachTask<T> scheduleForEachTask(double seconds, T[] data, Consumer<T> x)
      Schedules a task to iterate over an array of data elements.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the data.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The delay in seconds before executing the task.
      data - The array of data elements.
      x - The consumer function to execute for each data element.
      Returns:
      The scheduled ForEachTask instance.

    • scheduleForTask

      public TaskScheduler.ForTask scheduleForTask(double seconds, int iterations, Consumer<Integer> x)
      Schedules a task to iterate a specific number of times.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The delay in seconds before executing the task.
      iterations - The number of iterations.
      x - The consumer function to execute for each iteration.
      Returns:
      The scheduled ForTask instance.

    • start

      private void start()
      Starts the task scheduler in a separate thread.
